cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 450 miles south of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: turning north then north-northeast, tracking toward southeast Louisiana and the northern Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana near Port Fourchon–New Orleans area

weather_observation.watch_coast: West of Morgan City to Intracoastal City Louisiana under Tropical Storm Watch
weather_observation.warning_coast: Morgan City LA eastward to the MS/AL border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeastern Louisiana through southern Mississippi and Alabama to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) likely with the potential for hurricane-force gusts during landfall period
weather_observation.storm_surge: 4–6 ft possible along the lower Mississippi River delta and Lake Borgne region, 2–4 ft in Lake Pontchartrain
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated 6 inches, bringing flash and urban flooding risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes possible Wednesday and Wednesday night
